GapFillDragDrop.Title: Idioms
GapFillDragDrop.Instruction: Drag the correct answers to the spaces.

Content.Question:
1. Living life in the public eye can be intrusive as even the small details of your life can appear in
a newspaper or magazine.
2. Lola wears extremely plain suits to work, but her shoes are always very eye-catching, very bright and
always high heels!
3. It’s a good job I brought a sandwich and a drink to work. The office café is closed today.
4. Although the power cut came right in the middle of dinner, everyone saw the funny side of it in the end.
5. One of Edward’s pet hates is people who play music very loudly in their cars.
6. My grandmother is a shining example. She’s eighty-five and she still lives life to the full .
7. Nick says he loves his bachelor life but in the same breath he admits he wants to have lots of children!
8. June had a quiet word with her son about his reckless driving.
9. Ursula’s piercings have caused raised eyebrows among her family and friends.
10. My flatmate is obsessive about cleaning, and says we need to clean the flat every day. It’s really getting
on my nerves.
